content.text: A **formal language** is precisely defined by its **syntax** — rules for what counts as a well-formed expression. This precision lets us prove things about the language itself.

content.definition: A string of symbols that follows the syntactic rules of the formal language. 'P → Q' is well-formed; '→ P Q →' is not.

content.question: What makes a formula 'well-formed'?
options: It follows the syntactic rules of the language
It can be understood by humans
content.explanation: A well-formed formula follows the grammar rules of the formal language. Whether it's true is a separate question.
